qas.question: What is an example of a treaty from which it is not possible to withdraw?

answers.text: the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights

qas.question: What state declared its intention to withdraw from the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights?
Who, acting as registrar, informed North Korea that withdrawal was deliberately precluded by the original signatories of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights?

answers.text: the Secretary-General of the United Nations

qas.question: What two factors determine whether it is possible to withdraw from a treaty?

answers.text: the terms of the treaty and its travaux preparatoire

qas.question: The terms and travaux preparatoire of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights were both factors in determining what aspect of the treaty as it relates to North Korea's stated intentions?

context: <a4_0>The possibility of withdrawal<a4_0/> depends on <a3_0>the terms of the treaty and its travaux preparatoire<a3_0/>. It has, for example, been held that it is not possible to withdraw from <a0_0>the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights<a0_0/>. When <a1_0>North Korea<a1_0/> declared its intention to do this <a2_0>the Secretary-General of the United Nations<a2_0/>, acting as registrar, said that original signatories of the ICCPR had not overlooked the possibility of explicitly providing for withdrawal, but rather had deliberately intended not to provide for it. Consequently, withdrawal was not possible.
